author: David Anderson
title: Daniel Sturridge's Liverpool career hanging by a thread with Jurgen Klopp plotting summer shake-up
text:
Jurgen Klopp admits he finds it hard to explain defeats in English Share this video Watch Next 
The 27-year-old, whose £150,000-a-week contract runs until 2019, does not fit Klopp’s high-pressing style. His struggles have alerted West Ham and Stoke, and Klopp says he will make a decision on his future at the end of the season. 
“I have no idea what happens in the summer,” said the Reds, boss. “It is not only Daniel, but a lot of players. 
“Daniel did not train for eight or nine days because of a virus infection. Sturridge's trademark goal celebration has been seen just twice in league play this season (Photo: PA) 
"We have to bring him back to the best shape possible and then bring this season to an end as successfully as possible. 
“Then we will make decisions and speak about Daniel, and any other players, about what will happen at the end of the season. 
“A lot of things will influence this and we can speak about it when it is time.” poll loading Should Liverpool replace Sturridge in the summer? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
